casebody.data:
COMPAGNIE GENERALE TRANSATLANTIQUE, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. UNITED STATES, Defendant-Appellee. No. 66. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. Nov. 4, 1936. R. O’Donnell, of Washington, D. C., and Edward J. Garity, of New York City, for appellant. Lamar Hardy, U. S. Atty., of New York City (George B. Schoonmaker, Asst. U. S. Atty., of Ñéw York City, of counsel), for the United States.

Before MANTON, AUGUSTUS N. HAND, and CHASE, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Judgment affirmed in open court.
